document_data.name: South District
document_data.mainbody: The '''South District''' was a district of [[Huzuz]], the City of Delights, in [[1367 DR]].{{AQ-time}}
document_data.Description: The South District was found in the [[People's Quarter]] and covered much of the southern portion of Huzuz. The [[Road to Enlightenment|Enlightened Way]] ran along the western edge of the South District, separating it from the [[Peasants' District]]. Along the eastern edge ran the [[Pilgrims' Route]], bordering the [[Affluent District]] and [[Pilgrims' District]]. The Pilgrims' District also formed much of the northern boundary of the South District.
document_data.Inhabitants: Visitors to the South District had access to a wide array of services from vendors and entertainers.
document_data.Notable Locations:
* the Enlightened Way
* the Pilgrims' Route
